meanings.definition: To carve, cut, or engrave (something) into a surface.
meanings.sent1: She engrails her initials on the tree trunk.
meanings.sent2: The artist engrails intricate patterns on the metal plate.
meanings.sent3: He accidentally engrails his name on the wrong side of the paper.
meanings.sent4: The memory of her smile engrails itself in his heart.
meanings.sent5: The sculptor's chisel engrails a masterpiece from the marble block.

meanings.definition: To fix deeply or firmly in the mind.
meanings.sent1: The teacher engrails the importance of kindness in her students.
meanings.sent2: The song lyrics engrail themselves in his memory after just one listen.
meanings.sent3: He engrails the math formulas in his mind by turning them into songs.
meanings.sent4: The traumatic experience engrails a fear of heights in her mind.
meanings.sent5: The wise words of his grandfather engrail valuable life lessons in his mind.
